heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 13 October 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.6°C), outside temperature (down 3.4°C), and inside temperature (down 1.8°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 1.8°C), cloud levels (up 370 m), outside temperature (up 1.8°C), and inside temperature (up 2.4°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 236.3m lower than yesterday, 7.5m lower than the past week, 369.5m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1039m minimum and 2260m maximum, with an average of 1230.0m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1237.5m and 1599.5m.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, the air will feel dry and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dark. The weather will likely remain the same.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (86%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
